title: [BUG] The app crash during GC Finalization (with SKGLView)
body:
**Description**
Hi,

We have a Xamarin Forms app for macOS. 
In the app we display different types of drawing objects like rectangles, lines, circles, paths (SKPath), images (SKImage) etc. (in critical cases it can be a few thousands such objects).
To do this we use SKGLView.
The app allows to pan/scale canvas, create/move/scale/resize drawing objects.

In my case, when I create a few drawing objects (mostly SKPath - less than dozen) on an empty canvas, the app crash.
The wired thing is that the app crash on test machine which has 8 GB RAM.
On developer machines (3 persons) the app works properly (each of us has 16 GB RAM).

Report suggests that the problem is with releasing objects by GRContext (I guess) during garbage collecting.

Is there a way to fix it quickly ? 
We pushed our app Beta version to external Beta testers and such crash surprised us.  

Tip: We had similar issues during leaving and reopening ContentPage with SKGLView but GRContext.AbandonContext(releaseResources: true) helped.

Unfortunately, I cannot provide sample :(

**Code**
